intro: Ruschia hexamera, commonly known as the six-angled Ruschia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its small, fleshy, blue-green leaves and clusters of tiny, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance, it is often cultivated in arid regions.
